meanings.definition: To collapse or burst inward violently
meanings.sent1: The old building imploded after the demolition crew set off the explosives.
meanings.sent2: The balloon imploded when too much pressure was applied to it.
meanings.sent3: The cake imploded in the oven, creating a messy but delicious disaster.
meanings.sent4: The team's hopes imploded when their star player got injured right before the championship game.
meanings.sent5: The dam imploded under the force of the raging river, causing widespread flooding.

meanings.definition: To undergo a sudden and catastrophic failure
meanings.sent1: The company's stock price imploded after the scandal was exposed.
meanings.sent2: The rocket imploded shortly after takeoff, leaving behind a trail of smoke.
meanings.sent3: The party imploded when the cake fell on the floor, much to everyone's amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of becoming a singer imploded when she forgot the lyrics during the audition.
meanings.sent5: The fragile glass ornament imploded into a thousand pieces when it fell off the shelf.

meanings.sent1: The population of the town imploded after the factory closed down.
meanings.sent2: The team's chances of winning imploded after their star player got injured.
meanings.sent3: His excitement imploded when he realized he had forgotten his homework at home.
meanings.sent4: The balloon imploded as the air was let out, shrinking to a fraction of its original size.
meanings.sent5: The economy imploded under the weight of the financial crisis, leading to widespread unemployment.
